alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:48PM PST until December 06 at 1:22AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... South Fork Stillaguamish River Near Jordan Rd. Bridge affecting Snohomish County. Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County. .Rain will slowly taper off over night and move out of the area Wednesday. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Stillaguamish River near Jordan Rd. Bridge. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Flood stage is 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river crested this afternoon near 17.4 ft. and is falling below flood stage now. The river will continue to fall but flooding will continue until the flood wave has passed downstream out of the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1015 PM PST.
